page.title: 13Blewburton Hill
page.content: This lies to the East of the village of Blewbury on the Western outskirts of Aston Upthorpe. There are the remains of an Iron Age Hill Fort dating from about 350BC on the top of this local landmark. It is not known why this ealiest settlement was abandoned but the process of settlement and abandonment took place at least twice after this the final destruction of the settlement being in about 50AD. No further attempts were made to settle on hill and the present village seems most likely to have formed in post Roman times as a farming community. The hill is a local landmark with a few trees to the south of the crest along the line of the old rampart and ditch.
